snippet.title: April 29 Colorado Chemical Demilitarization Citizens’ Advisory Commission Meeting (2020)
snippet.description:
This is the April 29 Colorado Chemical Demilitarization Citizens’ Advisory Commission virtual meeting. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss the destruction of the chemical weapons stockpile at the U.S. Army Pueblo Chemical Depot. Highlights from the meeting are listed below. Please note, YouTube uses speech recognition technology to automatically create captions; the quality of the captions may vary.

• At approximately 2:54, Irene Kornelly, chair, CAC, introduces Michael Abaie, program executive officer, PEO ACWA, who provides opening remarks.
• At approximately 7:39, Col. Michael Cobb, commander, U.S. Army Pueblo Chemical Depot (PCD), provides a PCD update including depot response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
• At approximately 14:51, Ken Harrawood, project manager, Bechtel Pueblo Team, Kim Jackson, plant manager, Pueblo Chemical Agent-Destruction Pilot Plant (PCAPP) and Walton Levi, site project manager, PCAPP, provide a PCAPP update including: COVID-19 community support, pandemic planning efforts, main plant and Static Detonation Chamber (SDC) site staff procedure changes and upcoming plans for returning to work; safety; plant status; preparing for 105mm projectile campaign changeover; permitting updates; SDC key activities; and destruction progress. 
• At approximately, 38:09, Robert Jonardi, member, CAC, asks for a new metric explaining what percentage of hydrolysate was destroyed inside the plant instead of off-site shipment. 
• At approximately, 39:15, Levi and Harrawood continue with a PCAPP update including: baseline reconfiguration; problematic munitions; off-site shipment of hydrolysate; and economic impact.
• At approximately, 48:09, Jonardi, Velma Campbell, member, CAC, and Ken Griffin, member, CAC, ask if the acquisitions awards include the SDC, how far ahead of the permit process the acquisitions contracts are awarded, in reference to the “At-A-Glace” slide where the additional 600 local employees are from, and what contract companies are in and out of state.

The Pueblo Chemical Agent-Destruction Pilot Plant (PCAPP) is a state-of-the-art facility that is safely destroying the chemical weapons stockpile at the depot in Pueblo, Colorado. For more project information and news, visit the PCAPP homepage on the PEO ACWA website: http://www.peoacwa.army.mil/pcapp

For PCAPP environmental permitting updates and information, visit the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment’s web pages:
CAC Webpage: http://www.colorado.gov/cdphe/cocac 
PCAPP Permitting Webpage: http://www.colorado.gov/cdphe/pcapp
 
Connect with PEO ACWA:
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/peoacwa
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/peoacwa
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/acwanews
Flickr: http://www.flickr.com/photos/acwa
